result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Markel D Williams

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Markel D Williams not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Markel D Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Status Conference held.  Defense advises this matter may resolve with Defendant's felony in Br. 19.  Court authorizes transfer to Judge Ashley, Br. 19 if accepted.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Markel D Williams not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney Michael J Cerniglia appeared by video for Markel D Williams.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Court authorizes transfer to Branch 19 for resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Markel D Williams not in court, in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defendant has pending cases in branch 45 and this case is scheduled accordingly for reasons placed on the record.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael J Cerniglia in court, defendant Markel D Williams not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel has discovery and advises Court that defendant has pending felony cases in Judge Kies, Br. 45.  Court will authorize transfer of this case to Judge Kies for global resolution only.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Lonnie D. Jr and L.N.K.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Markel D Williams in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Markel D Williams in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Markel D Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
